Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Hi. Sara Matthews. She looks her up in the computer. She plays with a simple silver chain around her neck.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Told you we'd make it. She steps back to the doorway. As she hauls her suitcase off the cart... BOOM! Another cart slams into hers. A box tumbles off the other cart.

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: Sorry! Bad driver. Sara kneels to help the other girl -- cute, frizzy hair -- clean up the mess. A slew of clothes lie on the carpet. And peeking out from under them... a bottle of vodka. The girl smiles sheepishly.

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: In case of emergency.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Sara.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Hey. Yeah, it's amazing here. I met this really cool biker? He's taking me to Mexico this weekend.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Everything's great.

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: Psi U.'s throwing a bash. Let's go.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Psi U.?

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: They're a frat. Beer... guys...

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I don't know... I might just hang and wait for my roommate. Groans all around. "Come on"... "Lame-O"... Sara bites her lip, considering. She smiles.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Alright. Just let me change. The girls cheer.

Speaker: bouncer
Dialogue: If you want beer, I'll need ID's.

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: For a frat party?! Seriously? He holds up a handful of ugly lime-green wristbands. Kim steps around him.

Speaker: kim
Dialogue: I don't drink anyway. Tracy looks at her, mouth agape.

Speaker: bouncer
Dialogue: There's punch and non-alcoholic beer over there... He points to a table with a giant bowl and cups. No one is around it. Tracy tries to flirt with the bouncer.

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: Come on, just us. We won't tell. The bouncer is tempted but not budging.

Speaker: bouncer
Dialogue: Honestly, I'm just a pledge. They'll kick me out. She stomps by him.

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: Wuss. Defeated, Tracy walks over to the table. Turns back to Sara.

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: You want something to drink?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: What's the point? Tracy huffs as Sara walks into A SEA OF KIDS. We're talking extreme fire hazard... extreme moral hazard. Sara moves through the crowd. Her clothes are low-wattage, but stylish. She's drawn to the music coming from a large room. A HIGH-ENERGY COLLEGE BAND on stage. They're not very good, but they don't care. Sara finds a spot along the wall and watches them. In particular -- THE DRUMMER. A cute goof, spastically whaling away. He's mouthing the lyrics, eyes closed. Really into it. Sara chuckles at the sight, not taking her eyes off him. He definitely stands out. Suddenly, a hand grabs her shoulder. Tracy pulls herself in with Kim close behind and they start dancing to the band. Juice spilling over the brim of her cup. Sara stays by the wall, afraid of getting any spilled on her.

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: Why aren't you dancing?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: To this?

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: They're not that bad. Tracy pulls Sara deeper in the crowd. Now all three start jumping up and down to the music. Sara's getting into it as Tracy chugs her drink.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Crap. Kim still dances as Sara starts to look around.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Where's Tracy?

Speaker: kim
Dialogue: She was getting more punch. Sara then spots Tracy, with a full cup, precariously climbing onto the stage next to the DJ's table with a bunch of other girls already dancing. She starts dancing suggestively, egging on the crowd.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Uh oh. Guys yell out. "Show em." Several hands armed with camera phones stretch out above the crowd.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Damn! Sara's drenched as an enormous cheer erupts from the crowd. Camera phones clicking all at once. Sara looks up.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Oh. Woops.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Looks like my plan backfired. Sara turns back towards him.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: What plan?

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: To spill beer on you so I can start a conversation.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: You spilled beer on me purposely?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I'll get over it. He laughs, making her smile.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I'm not sure how she's so wasted. All she's had is punch. Stephen grins conspiratorially and grabs her hand.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Come on.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: It's pretty good. She drinks some more.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: It doesn't taste that strong.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Exactly. He takes a drink of his beer as Sara takes a long chug of hers.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Stephen. By the way.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Sara.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Hey, why do you get to drink beer?

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Twenty-one.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Old man.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Tell me about it. My back is killing me. They don't move for a moment, Sara's resting her back against his chest.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Besides, frat brothers don't have to wear those ugly wristbands.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Ugh. You're in this frat? He jokingly untwirls her away and she bumps into people behind her. Sara laughs as she notices Kim, dancing, Holding up a cup of punch.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: What happened to Tracy? Kim shrugs.

Speaker: kim
Dialogue: I'm the worst roommate ever. Kim goes back to dancing Sara looks a little worried which Stephen notices.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Do you want to look for your friend? Sara looks at him sweetly. Nods.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Guess that would be me. But then he stumbles, nearly dropping them both.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Who's got you? Stephen looks at Tracy in one arm. The other arm around Sara's waist.

Speaker: kim
Dialogue: Thanks Sara.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: No problem. They linger, smiling, checking out Stephen... They step into the elevator. Holding it for Sara.

Speaker: kim
Dialogue: You want us to wait? Sara turns and glares at Kim. An obvious "NO!" Kim lets the doors close as Sara turns back to Stephen.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: You know, I'm going to be pulling kitchen duty all week for helping girls leave a frat party. It's like opposite everything we stand for. Sara leans in and gives him a long kiss. Then separates, but her lips still very close to his.

Speaker: saea
Dialogue: Does that make it worth it?

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Honestly, no. She laughs out loud.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Do you want to come up?

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Keep it... till next time.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Thanks again. For everything.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Ow! She reaches her bed and plops down on her back. Breathing hard. Clenching her eyes shut. The room is spinning. She may puke at any second. She struggles to sit up. She fumbles for the lamp next to her bed, almost knocking it over. She hits the switch, revealing: The other bed. Sara screams.

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: Hi. FLASH. The girl takes her picture, further blinding and disorienting Sara.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Who are you?!

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: Rebecca. Your roommate. Sara calms, catching on.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: What are you doing?

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Taking your picture.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Why? Rebecca shrugs. Sara grabs her stomach.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Oh shit. Her cheeks chipmunk as she rushes out the door. Rebecca smiles.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Hey Sara. Sara stares at her blankly. Who is this girl? What happened last night? Rebecca smiles.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: We met last night.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Right...  Starts with a... "T"?

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Close. Rebecca. She hands Sara a glass of water and two aspirin.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Come on. It'll help, trust me. Sara washes down the aspirin.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Thanks. Rebecca smiles, genuinely touched.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Did you do those? Rebecca nods.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: They're really cool.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I just like capturing my moods. A beat. Sara closes her eyes. Bits and pieces of the night before are coming back to her now.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Rebecca -- did you take my picture last night?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: It's too damn early for me.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: It's three in the afternoon. Sara's eyes bug out.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Holy shit!

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: So what do we do? Sara looks her over. Checks out her outfit.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Nice bag. Dior?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I'm on financial aid.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I told you not to do this.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: You're just making it harder.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: That didn't sound good. Boyfriend?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Ex. Off Rebecca's confused look.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: It's complicated. A beat. Rebecca's warm smile makes Sara want to open up. They walk along the stacks of books.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: We dated since tenth grade and were supposed to go to college together.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: No?! He took it?  What an asshole.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Yep.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Do you miss him?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Sometimes I think I do.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: It's hard to let go.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Oh my God.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I am so jealous.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I know... I've got a lot of clothes. Mind if I put some on your side?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: No problem.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Borrow anything you want. Really. I haven't worn half of them. Sara reverently fingers through them. Chloe. De La Renta. Alexander McQueen. Jimmy Choo shoes. A Miu Miu handbag. Some still carry their price tags.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Jesus, some of these I've only ever seen in Vogue.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: My parents idea of bonding is to turn me loose in Beverly Hills with a Platinum card.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Oh, you here?

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Pasadena. Off Sara's confused look.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: That's cool. You can go home on weekends. Free laundry. Free meals.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Not gonna happen. Sara gives her a puzzled stare.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: It's a long story.. .Let's just say nothing's free in my house. She wants to know more... but it's too soon to pry. She nods at Rebecca's drawing pad.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Can I take a look? She walks over. Rebecca clutches the pad to her chest.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: No. Sara stops dead in her tracks. Rebecca realizes that came across pretty harsh.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Not till it's done. Nothing personal. It's just my... process.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I thought you were a design major. Why are you taking Calc and psychology? The girls get up with their trays.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: And they're requirements.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Hey. Tracy... Kim... this is my roommate, Rebecca. She turns, but Rebecca is standing at a distance. Sara waves her over. Rebecca comes, reluctantly. She flashes a small wave.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Hi.

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: RRRRRREBECCA. How formal. What can we call you?

Speaker: kim
Dialogue: How 'bout Reba? Tracy sticks her finger down her throat. Gag me.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I like Becca. Tracy's grimace vetoes that one, too.

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: How 'bout Becky?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Becky's good. The girls all turn to Rebecca for approval.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I like Rebecca. Buzzkill.

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: So... here we are. Design 101. And each one of you is asking yourself the same question...  Who is this guy? Why should I turn off my Blackberry and pay attention to him? Mild laughter from the class.

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: I'll tell you why -- because I hold the keys to the kingdom. Think of your favorite designers. Marc Jacobs. Vera Wang. Rick Owens. Magicians, right? I've got news for you: All of their magic stems from the same source: the fundamental principles of design.

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: The journey to the catwalks of New York... Paris... Tokyo... starts right here, in this room. And all you have to do is open your minds. Man, she wants in.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Professor Roberts? He flashes a disarming smile.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I'm sorry to bother you, it's just...

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: I'm afraid we're full. But don't worry -- Intro Design has three other sections.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: But you're not teaching them. I want to learn from the best. He smiles at her.

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: What's your name?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Sara Matthews.

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: Tell me, Sara -- why should I sign your request form when I've turned down a dozen others? Would that be fair? Sara's face falls. A long beat.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: No, I guess it wouldn't. Thanks anyway. She walks toward the door. Roberts' eyes go to her ass.

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: But...

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: Style. And Desire. He smiles, signs the form and hands it to Sara. Sara clutches the form to her chest, smiling.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Hey. Rebecca removes her earbud.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: What's your Facebook page? I'll add you as a friend.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I don't have a Facebook page.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Myspace?

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Nope. I don't spend a lot of time

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Come here. Rebecca walks over and looks at the computer over Sara's shoulder.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Who's she?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Irene. She graduated from the Art Institute out here last year.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: A design apprentice for Marc Jacobs. Hey, check out these posts. Sara scrolls down Irene's recent posts: "Paris was amazing"... "Milan in the Fall"... "Off to Barcelona"... etc.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I mean.. .who doesn't have a Facebook page?! Rebecca laughs.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Okay, okay. I'll get one. Tracy knocks on the partially open front door... and marches right in.

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: Cancel those library plans. Guess who made the guest list at Rebar?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Of course.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I don't.

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: Yes you do. Thanks to my badass self.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I'll pass. Clubs really aren't my scene. Tracy stands there, hung out to dry, the ID in her hand.

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: How great is this? No parents. No curfews.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: No shit! They clink their empty glasses in a toast.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Can I? She puts her wallet and cell phone into Tracy's purse.

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: Too bad Rebecca blew us off. Talk about the life of the party.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Don't be mean.

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: I'm just saying.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: She's just a little hard to get to know.

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: Yeah right...

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: What do you think?

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: I think... Tracy raises her shot glass. She and Sara clink and drink. Tracy waves at the suits again. Thanks guys.

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: We can do better. She takes Sara's hand and pulls her out onto the dance floor.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Tracy?

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Hello?

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Yes. She smiles.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I'm fine. Just in a hurry. She keeps pumping. Speeding it up. Rick ambles up to her, treading beyond appropriate personal space. He points to the "Full Service" sign.

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Just doing my job. She stands her ground as he places his hand over hers on the gas pump and squeezes. She looks down at his hand on top of hers. Then lets go of the pump, nudging his hand away.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: All done. She pulls the nozzle out of the tank and tries to place it back at the pump. He stops her. Motions to her face.

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: You have a little something. No, she doesn't. He, ever so gently, rubs his index finger and thumb on her cheek to remove the imaginary smudge until he lurches back.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Sorry. But she does it again, holding the lever down, dousing him head to toe. He scrambles backward out of range.

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: You spoiled c--- He spots the lighter in her hand. Dead stop. She absentmindedly flicks it. It sparks but doesn't light.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Pussy. She gets into her car and drives off. Leaving Rick soaked in gasoline.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Nice car.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: No idea, I couldn't find her. Rebecca sits down, dropping her purse and keys on the table.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: As long as I'm here... you hungry?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Starved. Sara smiles gratefully. Rebecca opens the menu.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I can't believe she ran out on you.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I know. Thanks for coming. Rebecca looks up from the menu.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Tracy had her shot tonight. Tomorrow you're all mine. I'll show you the big city.. .the right way. And I promise I won't abandon you. Deal? Sara smiles.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Deal.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: These are the modern pieces. A little wilder than the old stuff. She's a savvy tour guide, confident, at ease. She doesn't just walk past pieces -- she studies them. Sara's impressed. Sara's cell phone buzzes. She checks the display: "Jason". She tilts it so that Rebecca can see and rolls her eyes. She buries her cell phone in her purse. Sara spots a bizarre metal structure and walks over to it.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Okay, I have no idea what this is supposed to be.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: This is my favorite. Sara steps closer to examine it. Rebecca stays behind her.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I love how he captures her personality through her eyes. It's like she really wants to help you. Rebecca's hands tug anxiously at her shirt. She really wants Sara to like this painting. Sara moves even closer. She squints, trying to see what Rebecca sees. The woman's expression in the painting is actually pretty sinister. Sara's a little freaked out... but she turns to see Rebecca's hopeful expression. Sara brightens.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Amazing. I love it.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: That is so cool.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: No graffiti in Des Moines?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Sure. "Bobby loves Jenny. Chrissy loves Rick." Nothing like this. Rebecca pulls out her camera.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Hey, smile. Sara poses... but now grabs Rebecca and pulls her in.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Both of us.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Now that's one "art form" I don't get. Needles into skin? No thanks.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I have a tattoo. Rebecca smiles. Yeah, right. But she can see in Sara's eyes that she's serious.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Really? Sara pulls down her shirt and sweater a bit to reveal, over her heart, a simple tattoo: "Emily".

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: My older sister. She died when I was nine.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Oh, I'm sorry.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: This keeps her with me.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I always wanted a sister. Sara smiles and interlocks her arm with Rebecca's as they walk down the street.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Guess who I'm listing as my favorite artist on my Facebook page?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Don't laugh. It's about a small town girl making it in the big city.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Isn't every movie?! They both laugh.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Hey there.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Look at you. She kneels and pets it. The kitten purrs.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: No collar, baby? Sara glances around to see if anyone is watching.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I thought you'd like it. Rebecca sees the moving bulge under Sara's jacket. She cuts Sara a look. Sara sighs. Apprehensively, she unzips her jacket and the kitten pops out. Rebecca sits up. The kitten jumps over to her bed. She pets it.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Sara...

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I know, I know. It's stupid, and I've just broken about forty different dorm rules, and I should just take it to a shelter...

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Really?

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: It'll be our secret. Just between us. Rebecca keeps petting the kitten. Getting more attached.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I named her in the elevator. Cuddles. She smiles and scoops her up. Suddenly, her smile vanishes.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Is that my necklace? Rebecca touches it. She'd forgotten she still had it on.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Sorry. I was just trying it on. Sara puts down the kitten and walks to Rebecca, who quickly takes it off. Sara takes it back, annoyed. She rubs it protectively.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: This was my sister's.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Oh. Sara looks at it a moment longer. She looks at Rebecca.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: You can borrow anything of mine. Except for this. Okay? It's the only thing I kept of hers. Rebecca nods. Sara sits down on the bed next to her.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I'm really sorry.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: It's okay. You didn't know.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Were you two close?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Yeah. You're the first roommate I've had since she died. So, it feels a little odd.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: In a good way or a bad way? Sara smiles.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: A good way.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: This seems like a pattern. Sara smiles. She's psyched to see him, in spite of the havoc. She leans in and speaks quietly.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Just because I kissed you doesn't mean I'll let you cut in line.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: So what does it mean?

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Hey, the gentlemen of Psi Upsilon are reviving a sacred tradition tonight. Sara stares at him blankly. He smiles.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: We're having another keg party.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I.. dunno. I'm still having flashbacks from the last one. Sara laughs.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: You know what? How about if I use you as my excuse not to go. Sara smiles, bits of smoothie dripping from her apron.

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: Hey. Sara thinks about ignoring her but stops. Her tone is cold.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Hey.

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: Psi U. tonight?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: So you can ditch me again?

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: Sara... the guy had a Porsche. And a hot tub.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: That's your apology? Tracy jumps up and walks over.

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: What I meant to say is -- I'm sorry -- I totally screwed up. Down the hall, we see Rebecca open her door and peek out. She watches Tracy and Sara. Tracy gives Sara sad, puppy dog eyes. Sara laughs.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I forgive you. Tracy gives her a big, exaggerated hug. Over Sara's shoulder, she spots Rebecca looking at them. Tracy flashes a big smile. Relief at making up with Sara. But that's not how Rebecca takes it.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: But you're on your own at Psi U. Because...

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: You look... nice.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Actually, I... sort of have a date?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: You know, I could reschedule.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: You don't have to.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I want to. On one condition... Sara pulls a cute jacket from her closet and puts it on Rebecca. They both look at Rebecca in the mirror. Wow. Rebecca smiles.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I love it, who's the designer?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: What are you, a label whore?! Who cares ...I got it at a flea market and it looks great with the dress. Rebecca nods in agreement.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: It just needs one last touch... She grabs a pair of small, gold hoop earrings from her dresser. She places them in Rebecca's hand.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I'm gonna jump in the shower, then we'll head out. She grabs her stuff and hurries out the door. Rebecca eyes the earrings in her palm. She turns towards the full-length mirror behind the door. As she leans into the mirror, we see that her ears aren't pierced. She takes one of the earrings and touches the pin against the skin of her right lobe. After a moment of hesitation... SHE PUSHES THE PIN IN HARD. A small pop. She flinches. Blood trickles down her ear onto her neck. She wipes it off with her thumb and touches the other hoop to her left ear.

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: Water. I need water. She stumbles to the mini-fridge and looks in: Empty. She groans. She grabs an empty cup... opens her door... And lets out a sharp little scream.

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: Rebecca? What are you doing? Rebecca cocks her head at Tracy, as if she's trying to comprehend her. A beat. She stands... and walks to her. Tracy takes a step back, shaken by Rebecca's calm, morose demeanor. Rebecca stares right into her eyes. She makes a slight move towards Tracy, who flinches. Rebecca turns and walks down to her room. At her door, she turns and smiles. She disappears into her room. Tracy stands there, spooked.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Hey. How was the party? Are you still the beer bong queen? But Tracy's in no mood to joke. She pulls Sara to a stop.

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: Listen... something is up with your roommate.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: She was outside my room this morning.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Doing what?

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: Waiting for me. I opened my door... and there she was. Just sitting there, staring. Like some psycho.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Are you sure?

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: You don't believe me?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: No, it's just... why would she do that?

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: Why don't you ask her? I've gotta go...I'll see ya later. Tracy stops and watches Sara as she continues on. Tracy turns to go the other way, but before she leaves her eyes catch Rebecca standing in front of a nearby building. Rebecca stares at Tracy much like she did in the hallway. Tracy leaves in a hurry.

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: Contrary to popular opinion, beauty is not in the eye of the beholder. It's in the hands of the designer. Sara listens intently, soaking it all in. Her cell buzzes with a text message. She discreetly takes a look.

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: Who can tell me the difference between fashion and style? FROM IRENE: "4th & ford. be there now." Sara smiles at the message. Professor Roberts notices Sara looking at her cell phone and calls on her.

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: Miss Matthews? Without missing a beat, Sara replies.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Fashion's something you can buy, but style you either have or you don't.

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: Exactly. All the money in the world can't buy you style.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: But it can buy you a good stylist. The class chuckles. Professor Roberts smiles.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Hey. How'd you know when my class got out? Rebecca shrugs, playing it off.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I'm your roommate. Sara smiles and grabs a cup.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Listen... Tracy told me something kinda weird. She says you... scared her this morning. Rebecca stops and looks at Sara. She starts laughing.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: It's more like she scared me. She was racing to the bathroom like she was gonna hurl. She almost knocked me over. A beat as Sara ponders it all. She smiles.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: The girl does like to party. Anyway, I wouldn't worry about it. Rebecca takes a victory sip as Sara gets another text from Irene: "where r u?!?!?!"

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I gotta go meet Irene.  Thanks for the coffee. Rebecca watches her walk off. She takes another sip.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Finally. She gets up to hug Sara. Nearly tearing the dress.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I so want to be you when I grow up.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Hell, I wanna be me when I grow up.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: You know, your dad left me four messages last week. Making sure I'm looking out for his baby.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Oh god. I hope you told him I'm closing down the library every night.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: I told him I haven't seen you. And that for all I know you're a crack ho by now. Even the model laughs.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Perfect.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: I haven't seen you around too much since you blew me off for dinner.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Sorry again. Actually, how about dinner tonight?

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Hellllo. I'm studying. She takes his book. He's on page two.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Page two? Busted!

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Yeah, but it's really dense. Off Sara's smile.

Speaker: kim
Dialogue: How's it goin?

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: Hey. Tracy, wearing just a towel, and brushing her teeth as she walks, steps into the bathroom.

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: You have to be kidding me. Hey! The only light is some distorted moonlight through the window. Tracy steps out of the shower, grabbing her towel. Just as she starts to feel her way along the wall... The lights come back on. She sighs happily... sheds her towel... and steps back under the steaming water. A beat. The lights go off again.

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: Goddammit ! She turns off the shower. A beat of silence, but now... one of the other showers turns on. What the hell?

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: Hey, how about turning on the light?

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: Who's out there? Tracy, back in her towel, nervous now, feels her way along the wall again. She turns on the lights. The curtains are drawn in front of both running showers. Tracy stares at them. A beat.

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: I know it's you. She walks over to the shower. A beat. She rips away one curtain. Nothing behind it but the running shower. She turns it off. She stares at the other curtain.

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: Sara thinks you're weird. She told me. She pulls back the other curtain... nothing. She turns off that shower, too. But she can still hear running water. She looks back. The curtain from her own shower is closed again. The sound of running water behind it. She walks over.

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: Not funny, Rebecca.  Bitch. She grips the curtain. She steels herself. She yanks the curtain open to see... Just running water. Tracy shakes her head. She looks around -- no one. She slips her towel off and slips back under the water. Screw Rebecca -- she's going to finish this shower.

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: Freak. Just as the warm water starts to relax her... THE SHOWER CURTAIN CRASHES OVER HER, pile-driven by Rebecca. The curtain comes right off the rings. Tracy is slammed against the shower wall. She hits the floor hard, with Rebecca on top of her. Water pelting them both.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: So Sara thinks I'm weird? Let me tell you what I think. I think you're a little whore, and a bad influence on her. And I think that if you tell anyone about... what I'm about to do... you'll regret it. Rebecca, one hand still on Tracy's mouth, slides her other hand beneath the shower curtain. Tracy's eyes widen further. Rebecca finds what she's looking for... gets the grip she needs... and violently jerks her hand out of the curtain. A muffled scream from Tracy. Tears stream down her face. Rebecca stands. As Tracy sobs quietly on the shower floor, Rebecca looks down at... The bloody ring in her hand.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Nice belly ring. She tosses it to Tracy... and walks away.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: I'm going to flunk my test tomorrow, thanks to you.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Then let's make sure it was worth it. She gives him a slow, lingering kiss.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Duh, joke's on you. I was going to flunk anyway. She smiles.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Thanks for helping me... not study.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Anytime. He kisses her. Sweet and tender. Until... Sara sees Rebecca. Standing just five feet away. Staring at them.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Where were you?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Oh, hi.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I kept calling and calling.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Oh. I turned my cell off at the library and forgot to turn it back on.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I'm going to bed now. I'm glad you're okay. She walks out of the lounge. A beat. That was awkward. Sara bites her lip, as if to say: "What can you do?"

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: You got a curfew?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Well, she's right...I shoulda called. He smiles -- no big deal. He kisses her and steps into the elevator. They look at each other, waiting for the ancient doors to close. Stephen steps forward and sneaks in one more kiss. The doors close. Sara smiles; what a night. She glances down toward her door and sighs.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I guess I'll see you later.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Sara...

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: You don't need to worry about me. I can take care of myself. Okay? Rebecca slowly nods.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Sara. We're good, right? A beat. Sara nods and smiles.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I'm already her best friend?

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: That's a little sad.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Stop. But the look on her face says she agrees.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Maybe she REALLY likes you...if you know what I mean. She looks at him quizzically.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I don't. He just looks at her, raising his eyebrows suggestively.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Stephen. Stephen stops dead. Did he hear something? Guess not. He keeps going, scanning the book numbers again.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Shit, wrong aisle. He doubles back, and turns into Rebecca's aisle. But it's... EMPTY. We hear a door close in the distance.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Should we head back home? They walk by a small playground comprised of the slide, jungle gym, etc.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: The question is "whose home?"

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Hmmm...

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I'll make you a bet. I go back to your place or you take me home to my twin bed and roommate.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: What's the bet? She eyes the jungle gym.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: This is kind of a stupid bet.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Why'd you agree?

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Apparently, I'm kind of a stupid guy.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Making me laugh isn't going to help you. They stare each other down. She's stifling a laugh, much more in control as Stephen is straining.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: So. She seductively walks back towards him. Takes his hand.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: So...let's go back to your place. She gives him a seductive grin.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Mmmm?

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I want you, Jason.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I miss touching you. Do you miss touching me?

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Prove it.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Just give me thirty seconds.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: You're kidding.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Almost there.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Yeah, right. He's not quite buying it... but he's cleaning faster.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: You know I don't believe you.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: I'm just going to put your clothes back on and make you strip again.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Who do we have here? Hey guys! Let me ask you. Bra or panties? Bra? Okay, okay. Just calm down. The door swings open. Stephen stands in front of her, grinning.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: I knew you didn't have the guts. She flicks her bra at his face. He catches it, shocked. He tosses it aside and yanks her into the room. The door slams shut behind them.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Say my name, Jason. Until I tell you to stop. She puts the phone on speaker and lays it on the pillow beside her. Both her hands ease back under the covers.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Sara...

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Don't ever call me again. She kills the call. And now deletes it from the phone log.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Well, good morning.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Hey. Sorry I didn't call. I forgot my phone.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: No problem. Sara opens her desk drawer and grabs her phone. She quickly checks. No calls. Rebecca looks Sara over and smiles.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Come on...don't I get any details??

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: You want to go get some breakfa-- Before she can finish, Cuddles bolts out the door and down the hallway.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Oh no. Sara chases after her as Rebecca gets up from her bed.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Maybe...

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Yes. Sara walks back to her room. Rebecca stands in the doorway. They exchange despondent looks. Screwed.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: What took you so long?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I walked.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: You didn't!

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: It's ten bucks for a cab and I'm a student.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Sara! You can't just walk around downtown L.A. at night. This is not Des Moines.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Duh?

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Seriously, listen to me. That's why I own a gun. Sara's shocked.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: What?!

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Absolutely! Big cities are crawling with crazies. Sara moves into the apartment. Her phone rings. She answers.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Hey. Oh, Hi. Yeah, I'm over at Irene's. I meant to leave you a note. Uh huh, uh huh, oh! That's a good idea. Let me check, hold on. Sara covers the phone and turns to Irene.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Yeah, why?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: We have to get rid of one.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Can't. Travel too much. Poor thing would starve to death.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: You're right.  No, she can't. Huh? Oh I don't know... whenever I get there. Bye.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Who was that?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: My roommate. More than a little overprotective.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: That's no fun.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: So, where is it?

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: You said you had a surprise for me?

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Oh yeah. I went through my closet. There's nothing here I've worn in the past six months. Irene walks toward the couch where there's a pile of clothes.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: You're kidding, all of these?! Oh no.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: What ...what?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: We have no closet space at the dorms. Rebecca's already using half of mine.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Oh my God, I just had the best idea.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Why don't you move in here with me?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Seriously?

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Yeah, I'm never here. The place is huge. Ditch the roommate. And, the building allows pets.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Huh. Let me talk to Rebecca about it.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Great.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: We broke up.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Yeah ...he sucked.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Hey. What're those?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Irene gave them to me. She had a lot more but we don't have the room.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Too bad she couldn't take Cuddles, huh?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Well, maybe that's not a problem.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Really?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Yeah. She actually suggested that I move in with her.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: No, of course not. I love living here... with you. Sara smiles as she sits down next to Rebecca, trying to put a bright spin on things.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Look, I'd still technically be living here. So you wouldn't have to get a new roommate. Her place is huge and it's not like you couldn't use the extra closet space. I'd just move some of my stuff over, and spend a few nights a week there. We'd both have a lot more space.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I don't want more space. I want... She checks herself. A beat of awkward silence.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Nothing's set in stone. It's just something to think about. Plus we'd be able to keep Cuddles. As Sara hangs more new clothes in her closet, Rebecca stares across the room at... Cuddles.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Tracy! Tracy slows for a split-second, then keeps walking. As if she didn't hear anything. Sara hurries to catch up with her.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Tracy... hey.

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: Oh, hey. Tracy smiles, but weakly. The girl's lost all her sparkle. Her eyes dart around nervously, like a bird's.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I heard you changed dorms.

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: Yeah, Conrad Hall. Seemed like a better vibe.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Well, we should get together. Like grab a bite or something. Right?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Hi. Rebecca starts to walk over to Tracy and Sara.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Tracy?!

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: What was that about?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I don't know. She just walked away.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Well, she's always been a flake.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Well, actually, I was thinking I'd do Thanksgiving here and see you guys for Christmas. She listens, her face telling us that she doesn't like what she's hearing.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Ya know what, I'm at work, and I'm really getting slammed... There isn't another customer in sight.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I'll call you later, okay? Tell Dad I said hello. Bye. She hangs up the phone and sighs.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Looks like it's just you and me tonight.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Hey, what's wrong? Rebecca looks up at her, eyes red. Ashamed.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Cuddles got out.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Oh no. In the dorm?

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Outside.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: What?!

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I was doing laundry... I took her with me... She jumped out of the bag and ran outside. I went after her, but...

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Maybe she'll come back.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I'm going to go find her.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Do you want me to help? But Sara's already gone, slamming the door behind her.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Maybe it's... just karma or something. We weren't allowed to keep her anyway.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: You're not mad at me?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: It was an accident.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Is something else wrong? A beat as Sara decides whether to confide.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: My parents really want me to come home for Thanksgiving.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: You don't want to go?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: It's not exactly the most festive holiday in the Matthews household.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I know I should be there with them, but it's like there's a ghost at the table.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: You can come with me.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Yeah, spend Thanksgiving at my house.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Your folks wouldn't mind?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Okay, we'll see. Thanks.

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: Your midterm designs are due Friday. Remember, class: Simplicity. Who founded our industry? Eve -- when she handed Adam that fig leaf. Students laugh on their way out the door. As Sara walks past Roberts...

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: Sara. Could I see you in my office, please?

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: I don't think I need to tell you how impressed I've been with your work.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I'm not sure I understand. Are you saying what I think you're saying?

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: I'm saying you have a shot. You'd have to earn it, Sara.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Of course. I'll do... anything. Roberts stands and walks to the window. He looks out at the quad... and now turns back to Sara.

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: I'd like to see more danger in your work. Your designs are always crisp; they're always clear. But they're a little... safe. That stung. Sara can't keep the red from rising in her face. Roberts walks over to her.

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: Don't be afraid to go to some of the... He delicately taps her temple.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Okay... He squats beside her, his hand on her shoulder now. He looks into her eyes.

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: The best designers push the boundaries of what's... acceptable. They take chances. Do you like to take chances, Sara?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Sometimes.

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: So do I. He kisses her. Sara pushes him away, jumping out of her chair. She stands in front of him, shaking.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I can't believe you just did that.

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: I took a chance, that's all. With a student that I trust.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I better go. Sara grabs her books. As she heads for the door...

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: Paris, Sara. Fashion Week. Don't blow the chance of a lifetime. She hurries out of the office.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: What's wrong?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: My design professor just kissed me. Rebecca turns very serious. She gets up and sits down next to Sara.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Are you alright? Sara nods.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Yeah, it just really creeped me out. And I think the asshole's married.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Professor Roberts?

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: That's right.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I'm glad I caught you.

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: Actually, I was just... But Rebecca steps past him into the office, her heels snapping on the worn hardwood floor.

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: You're not one of my students.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Not yet. That's why I'm here.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I'm failing Intro Pysch.

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: And why is that?

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Because I'm bored. I thought it would be all about Freud, and deep dark secrets. But it's brain chemistry. Synapses. I can't stay awake in class.

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: I'm sorry to hear that. But I'm not sure what I can do to help.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Tomorrow's the last day to drop a course without penalty. Unless I can add another one in its place, I'll fall way behind in credits. Daddy won't take that very well. He might even pull the plug. Which means...

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: Look, I've always made it a policy not to accept any students this late in the term.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Do I look like just any student to you? She smiles... and eases up onto his desk. Facing him. Pretty feet dangling, ankles locked. Jesus. She eases her purse off her shoulder and onto the desk. She sees the framed picture of a WOMAN AND TWO KIDS. She picks it up.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Your wife is very pretty.

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: Ex-wife . The game is on now. Roberts slowly walks around the desk, until he's behind Rebecca. In the picture frame's reflection, Rebecca sees him slip off his wedding ring. He palms it.

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: A few things I'd need to know.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Ask me anything. He's circling the desk now. Predator and prey.

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: Do you have any design experience?

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: None.

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: What do you know about clothes?

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Only one thing.

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: And what's that?

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I definitely look better out of them than in them. What an answer. Roberts stops in front of her. He moves in close, between her parting legs. He looks into her eyes. Still steady.

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: I think we might be able to work something out.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Great. Just tell me and I'll do anything.

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: Kiss me.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Ow! You're hurting me! Professor, stop!... Roberts stares at her in shock. He's not even touching her. What's going on? Rebecca smiles again. This girl is whacked. But damn, Roberts wants her. And her eyes are inviting him back. As he presses in to kiss her again... She rockets a knee into his groin and he crumples to the floor, gasping for air. He drops his wedding ring, which rolls away across the floor. Rebecca steps to the desk, where her purse sits open. We can see the Walkman inside. She takes it out. Smiles at him.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Birthday gift. You should get one, they're great. She slips on the earbuds... plays with the Walkman for a few seconds... and now hits the play button. We hear their prior conversation, played back.

Speaker: walkman
Dialogue: Great. Just tell me and I'll do anything.

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: You bitch tease!

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Oh, I'm not teasing. She starts to circle him now, as he writhes in pain on the floor.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Do you see enough danger in me now, Professor? Did I go to a dark enough place for you? He recognizes his own words to Sara.

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: What? How did?... Who are you? He lunges at her ankle. She steps out of his grasp... and slams the sharp spike of her heel down on his hand. He yells again.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: She trusted you. She walks toward the door.

Speaker: professor roberts
Dialogue: Please don't do this. Twenty years. Everything I worked for. I'll pay for that tape. Rebecca stops at the door. She kneels, picks up his wedding ring, and rolls it across the floor to him.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Yes you will. She walks out the door.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Anything wrong? Sara is taken out of her own world

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Are you ok?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Yeah, sure.

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: Welcome. I'm Professor Jacobs. I'll be taking over the class for the rest of the semester. Sara can't believe it. She takes a seat and turns to the STUDENT next to her.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Remember what I told you about Professor Roberts?

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Yeah?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: He's gone.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Well, they're calling it a leave of absence. But what I heard... someone sent the dean an anonymous recording of him hitting on another student.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Oh My God.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I know.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: That's called Karma.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: I've made a decision. You ready?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Lemme hear it.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: I'm gonna quit the band.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: No. Really? Why?

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: It's a waste of time-and we suck.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Why would you say that?

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Well, let me think about this. The only places we can get booked is at my own frat house and at my girlfriend's coffee shop.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Hold it. Did you just say girlfriend?

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: You heard me.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: So you think it'll be fun to stay here during Thanksgiving?

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Dinner at the frat, the football games. Don't forget the always awkward, homoerotic humor.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Sounds like a blast.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Oh. For sure.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Oh my God. What happened? She cradles Rebecca, who buries her head in between her knees. Sara checks the bruises on her head and arms.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Rebecca. It's okay. You're safe now. Talk to me.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I was looking for Cuddles. A man... pulled me into an alley. He tried... Sara holds her. She can't finish.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: It's okay. It's okay. Shhh.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I got away.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: You're alright now. Sara notices a streak of blood against Rebecca's shirt. She pulls it up and sees a slash. Gasps.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: It's not deep, thank God. But you should see a doctor.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Rebecca, you need to. And then the police.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I don't want to. I can't. Sara pulls out her cell phone.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: You're calling them, or I am. There's a psycho walking around this campus.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Okay, okay. I won't call. Just let me help you. Rebecca calms down. Let's Sara finish. Watching her intently as she works.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Sorry about not staying. But, Rebecca...

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: I get it.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Just say you'll miss me.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: I'll miss you. Rebecca pulls up in her car. Sara gets in. Rebecca gives Stephen an "I win" look as Sara closes the door.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I haven't heard from Jason in weeks. It's weird how he just stopped calling.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: It's what you wanted, right? Sara nods, reassuring herself.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Yeah. Yeah it is. Sara looks out the window. Rebecca shows a hint of a smile.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: This is your home?

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: It's my parents house. It was never a home.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Nothing.

Speaker: dad
Dialogue: Nothing? This isn't nothing.

Speaker: dad
Dialogue: Hello. And you are?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I'm Sara. She puts out her hand, but cuts Rebecca a look. You didn't tell them?

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Sara's my roommate.

Speaker: mom
Dialogue: It's so great to meet you, Sara. I'm Alison. Rebecca grabs Sara by the arm.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Come on, let me show you my room.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: You didn't tell them we were coming?

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: They didn't need to know. Rebecca plops down on the bed. Sara looks around. It's a typical teenage girl's bedroom. Except, no posters. Just drawings covering the walls. The drawings are of teenage girls -- more precisely, they're different drawings of one teenage girl. They're odd, but compelling.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: These are interesting.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Yeah, some of my high school work. I haven't gotten around to takin them down.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Rebecca's a pretty great artist.

Speaker: jeff
Dialogue: Yeah, we think Rebecca is so talented. Rebecca shakes her head, uncomfortable with the flattery.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: She's an awesome roommate, too.

Speaker: jeff
Dialogue: (looks at his daughter,

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Dad!

Speaker: jeff
Dialogue: What? As a parent you worry. You protect your daughter all her life and then she goes off to college and she's on her own. I'm just relieved she got a good roommate. Sara cuts discreet looks around the table. Who are these people?

Speaker: alison
Dialogue: Sara, I'll make up a room for you --

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: She'll stay in my room. Sara turns to Rebecca, confused but willing to go along.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: We can share the bed if you want. Sara looks down at her own "bed" and takes a glance at the walls. On the floor, she's going to be surrounded by the drawings of Rebecca looking at her.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Sure. Sara climbs into bed with Rebecca. They lay back to back. Rebecca turns the lamp off next to the bed.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Thanks for coming.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Next Thanksgiving, you can run interference with my family.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Done. Sara closes her eyes. It's silent. Rebecca turns over. A beat. She opens her eyes -- just inches from Sara. She ever so slowly raises her hand and gently strokes Sara's hair.

Speaker: kitchen
Dialogue: Jeff opens the fridge. The soft light barely illuminates Rebecca, sitting stoically at the table behind her father. Jeff jumps. He recovers, standing by the open fridge.

Speaker: jeff
Dialogue: Becs. You scared me. Rebecca, glass of milk in her hand, gives her father a dirty look. We know how much she hates nicknames.

Speaker: jeff
Dialogue: How're you doing?

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Fine. My grades are good.

Speaker: jeff
Dialogue: That's not what I meant. She looks down at the table.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I'm making friends. Jeff, very subtly, cringes. A long beat.

Speaker: jeff
Dialogue: Rebecca, look at me for a second. Now she looks at him.

Speaker: jeff
Dialogue: Your mother and I are very fond of you.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I know. He doesn't know what else to say. Outside Sara sees the framed photos on the wall. Each features Rebecca's parents in some exotic locale: On the beach... on the ski slopes... on a cruise ship. They smile happily at the camera. Rebecca isn't in a single picture.

Speaker: jeff
Dialogue: I just wanted to make sure. Good night, I'm heading back to bed. He rises. Sara turns and walks up the stairs.

Speaker: alison
Dialogue: Hi Sara.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Hi. Rebecca's going to show me some of her high school hangouts.

Speaker: alison
Dialogue: Wonderful. Alison peers up the stairs.

Speaker: alison
Dialogue: Rebecca seems to be doing well.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Uhhh, yeah. I think she is.

Speaker: alison
Dialogue: Is she taking her medication?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Medication? Alison turns to see... her daughter at the top of the stairs. Did she hear them? She walks down.

Speaker: alison
Dialogue: Hey sweetheart. She kisses her on the cheek. Rebecca is annoyed.

Speaker: alison
Dialogue: Have a great time, you two.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Is everything okay?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Yeah. It's just... She wants to ask her about that medication.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Nice to see where you come from.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Thanks. The cashier stares at her, as if trying to figure Sara out. What's she doing with Rebecca? The girls sit at a table. The cashier and BARISTA keep glancing over, whispering to each other. Rebecca shoots them a look. Like a warning. They quiet. Start doing busy work.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: You know them?

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: They went to my high school.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Friends? Rebecca doesn't answer her. She's focused on making eye contact with the Brunette. The girls linger by the door, whispering among themselves. Finally, the Brunette sits down at a table by the entrance. As far away from Rebecca's and Sara's table as possible. The other two girls walk to the counter. They sneak glances at Rebecca as they order their drinks. Sara looks back and forth between Rebecca and the girls. Rebecca doesn't waver. She keeps staring at the Brunette. Suddenly, Rebecca gets up.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Let's leave. Rebecca walks towards the door. Sara, confused, gathers her things and gets up. Rebecca stops at the Brunette's table. The Brunette sits there, like a deer caught in headlights.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Hello, Maria.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Oh, I wanted to introduce you to Sara. My roommate. Sara gives a small wave to Maria, who looks her over. Almost as if she feels sorry for her.

Speaker: maria
Dialogue: Hi. Rebecca keeps eyeing Maria, a superior grin on her face. An awkward beat. Everyone's tense. Sara clears her throat.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Well, we better go. Rebecca snaps out of it. Nods. They start to walk out. But as they open the door...

Speaker: maria
Dialogue: Rebecca. Everyone turns to Maria. She looks Rebecca in the eye.

Speaker: maria
Dialogue: We were never friends. Rebecca stares at her, grinding her teeth. The tension building. Maria doesn't back down, though. She needed to say this. Sara grabs Rebecca's shoulder, gently.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Come on, let's go.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I guess college is a fresh start for both of us. Rebecca doesn't look at her. Just a hint of acknowledgement on her face. Sara's phone buzzes. This gets Rebecca's attention. Sara looks at the text message she just received from Irene: "back in LA. lemme know abt movin in."

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Irene's back in town. Sara types and sends a text back. Rebecca watches her.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Good run?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Great. You wanna go get dinner?

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I'm going to the art studio.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Oh. Okay. Catch you later then.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Don't wait up, Sara...

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Forgot my pad. She snags it from her bed and leaves. Sara eyes Rebecca's dresser. But first... She walks to the door and opens it.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Your door was open.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Oh my God.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Sorry. Sara grabs him and gives him a long hug. Stephen holds her tight and speaks, muffled by her neck.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: What are those? A beat. Should she bring him into this?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: That's what I intend to find out.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Jesus. I thought she was just weird.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: It says lithium can control the condition.  Maybe these are refills. Maybe she's been taking it all along.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Certainly doesn't seem like she's been taking them. He's right and she knows it. A beat.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I think it's time I moved in with Irene.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: I'm sorry to stare, but you are so beautiful.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Thanks. So are you. Great lips. What kind is it?

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: It's cinnamon. Caffeinated. A girl never knows how late she's gonna party. Rebecca smiles. A beat.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Can I try it? Irene hands her the lip gloss... Rebecca takes her hand and pulls her close. She kisses Irene full on the lips.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: You're right... cinnamon. Irene smiles. This room's heating up fast. Irene's eyes meet Rebecca's.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Why don't we get out of here. I'd invite you to my place, but I have a roommate.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: As luck would have it, I'm only two blocks away and...no roommate.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: What are we waiting for?

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Shit. She looks at an empty glass on her bedside table.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Hey!

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Hey yourself. Where were you all night?

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Oh, I got inspired. I just lost track of time. Sara pulls off her sweaty top and throws it in the hamper, grabbing a towel. She's wearing a sportsbra, revealing her tattoo. Sara grabs a robe. A beat. She's nervous, but she needs to do this. Time for the "big talk." She sits on her bed and faces Rebecca.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I want a tattoo.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Uhhh...

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Please. It would mean a lot to me. I won't be able to do it without you. Sara looks into her plaintive eyes. So much want in them.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Um... sure. Okay.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: You can't rush this, Rebecca. We can always come back.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I know what I want.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Okay. I'm out here if you need me. Sara sits down as the TATTOO ARTIST escorts Rebecca upstairs. She looks giddy and nervous. Sara waves. When she's gone, Sara takes out her phone and texts Irene.

Speaker: stairs
Dialogue: Rebecca walks slowly down the stairs. Wincing in pain. Sara puts the phone back in her pocket and stands up.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Let's see it. Rebecca pulls down the collar of her shirt to reveal, just under her collarbone:

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: If you want... you can call me Emily. Sara clenches her fists. She's shaking with rage. She moves toward Rebecca, whose grin fades.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: What's the matter? Sara steps up to her, inches away, ready to beat the shit out of her. And Rebecca can't believe it. She's that far gone. Her eyes search Sara's for an answer. Sara abruptly turns and walks out the door. Rebecca watches her leave through the front window. Sara never looks back.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: This is all you're taking?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I'll get the rest of my things when Irene comes back to town. He takes the box. Then notices --

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Where's your necklace? She instinctively rubs the base of her neck.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I can't find it. It's okay.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Sara...

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I'm not going back up there. He hands her the box. Time to man up.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Wait here. I'll go look for it. She kisses him tenderly, unbelievably appreciative.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Have you seen Sara's necklace? Rebecca solemnly shakes her head. He looks around the dresser. In the drawers. Flips over Sara's pillow. Rebecca watches him.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: What did I do? He stops searching. Looks at her.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: She just needs to move on.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: With you? He doesn't answer. He keeps searching... but he can feel Rebecca's eyes on him now. Creepy. He gives up.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: If you do find it, can you let me know? Instead of answering, Rebecca raises her camera and takes his picture. Stephen stares at her, unnerved. He finally snaps out of it and walks out the door. She watches him go.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: You should call someone. The dean's office. Or at least your R.A. She keeps cleaning.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: And tell them what? What has she really done to me? No one can do anything.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Well, she sure scared the shit out of me. Sara really wants to change the subject. She holds up two of his t-shirts.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Are these dirty or clean? Stephen sniffs the shirts.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Somewhere in between. She throws the t-shirts at him.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Seriously. Is it a game to be as loud as you possibly can? She waves her arms like a crazy person.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Hey, I'm going to hit the library.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: No, it's okay.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Party starts at ten. Really cool band...

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: I hear the drummer's really hot.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: He may be, but I'm sleeping with his girlfriend... She kisses him.

Speaker: jason
Dialogue: Sara. I'm actually... I'm in front of your dorm. I just flew in. I'm at the Roosevelt Hotel, room 210. Call me, okay? He hangs up. Some students leave the dorm and he grabs the door before it closes.

Speaker: jason
Dialogue: Rebecca crumples up the paper and throws it in the trash.

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: Help me find the keg?

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Sure, I have to go look for my girlfriend anyway. She walks away. "Jerk". He grins... and now checks his watch. Where's Sara?

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Shhhh. She crawls onto him, not letting him turn over. She starts kissing the back of his neck.

Speaker: jason
Dialogue: Sara?

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Mm-hmmm. Kissing his back now, moving lower.

Speaker: jason
Dialogue: Oh, man, Sara. Oh, that feels good. She works her way back up to his ear.

Speaker: jason
Dialogue: I love you, Sara. She lets him have one, two, three seconds of heaven. Her hands reach behind her and ease out the utility knife.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: But she doesn't love you. Jason's eyes fly open. That wasn't Sara's voice. And those aren't Sara's eyes boring into his. Rebecca leans down, her face to his. Jason's eyes widen in shock, horror, and now pain as her unseen hands drive the knife deep into his gut. He gasps.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: You hurt her. She kisses him -- the last thing he'll ever feel. He shudders, trembles, and lies still, eyes open.

Speaker: librarian
Dialogue: We're about to close. Sara can't believe it's so late. She puts her things away. Grabs her phone to check the time, distracted by the "1 new voicemail" message. She's about to press the voicemail button... But a text comes in from Irene:

Speaker: frat boy
Dialogue: All hands on deck -- the keg's still alive.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Irene?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Irene? There's a bedroom dead ahead. Warm light pours out. She slowly walks to the open door... looks in... and freezes. CLOSE ON SARA'S EYES. Horror-stricken by what she sees. The bedroom is dark, except for the single lamp, above... Irene. She lies on the bed, each of her wrists cuffed to a bedpost. A red Hermes scarf is stuffed in her mouth. Sara can't move. She stares at Irene in shock.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Rebecca! Rebecca holds the gun steady on Sara.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Sit down and shut up. Sara lowers herself into a black chair, her eyes on Irene. Rebecca picks up Sara's cell phone.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Listen to me. All I ever wanted was to be your friend. A beat. Sara knows she has to play this just right.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Rebecca, you are my friend.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: No. Shut up. We're not friends. We're here because you betrayed me.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Rebecca, I'm sorry--

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Stop it. Stop saying things you don't mean. I protected you. From that whore Tracy and that nasty little kitten... and That scumbag of a professor...

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: What're you talking about? What'd you do to them? What'd you do to Jason?

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I got rid of them all. And how do you repay me? By leaving me. Sara sinks out of the chair onto her knees in astonishment. She looks at Irene. Sara digs deep... lifts up her face... and looks Rebecca in the eye. She puts everything she has into this.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Rebecca, please forgive me. A long beat. Rebecca's face lights up.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Now we can start all over again. Let's make things the way they were, Sara. That first day. Just the two of us. Sara sees Rebecca start to twist a garbage bag in her hands.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Rebecca...

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: After all... you can only have one best friend.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: No! Don't! Rebecca whips the bag around Irene's head. Irene starts to buck and thrash. But it doesn't help her...

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Lay still bitch.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Please. Don't do this... Sara stands. She stares at Irene. She can't watch her die. She walks toward the bed, ignoring Rebecca's gun.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Stop! I mean it. Rebecca raises the gun to Sara's face but Sara keeps coming. Rebecca realizes she can't stop Sara. She cracks Sara across the temple with the gun-butt, knocking her to the floor. She kneels down beside Sara. Worried... clearing the hair from Sara's face.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Don't make me hurt you, Sara. I just want to be your friend.

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: My phone. My phone. She nods her head and Sara sees the phone on the bed table. She rushes for it. No good the wire is cut!

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Shit!

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: The window! There's a fire escape. You can reach it.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I know you're scared, Sara. But I promise, everything is gonna be okay. She stops short at the sight of...Sara on the ledge. Rebecca turns and stares at Irene. Fresh panic rising in Irene's eyes.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Sorry, Irene. But she's my friend, not yours. She raises the gun at the helpless Irene... But out of nowhere STEPHEN, RUSHING UP FROM BEHIND, knocks her arm. The gun fires wildly, one bullet...

Speaker: irene
Dialogue: Hurry!! He sees Sara dangling outside and reaches for her.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Okay I've got you. Everything is gonna be okay! He pulls her halfway in the window... But a shadow rises behind him.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Stephen. Stephen is out. She sees the gun in his belt. She pulls it out, spins, and levels it at Rebecca. The gun shakes violently in her hand. Rebecca stands and walks calmly towards Sara, who is still on the floor.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: You won't do it. We're fr-- Sara pulls the trigger. Click. Rebecca stares in shock. Click. Click. Click. Click. Sara closes her eyes in frustration. She drops the gun. Tears stream down Rebecca's face. She can't believe Sara pulled that trigger. But as if flipping a switch... Rebecca's sadness turns to rage. She balls her fists, her knuckles white, and... CHARGES at Sara full force, slamming her against the wall. She tosses her like a ragdoll across the room, where... Sara's head slams the nightstand, knocking the contents of Rebecca's purse everywhere. Rebecca wipes the tears from her eyes. It hurts her to hurt Sara.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Friends help each other. They take care of each other. Sara, dazed and weak, stares at Rebecca.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Rebecca. We were never friends. That's the last straw. Rebecca comes hard, murder in her eyes. She grabs Sara around the throat, pulls her up from the floor, and slams her against the wall. She starts choking the life out of her. Sara's face turns red. Redder... But suddenly Rebecca's grip loosens. Her eyes stare in shock. Sara pulls Rebecca's hands off her neck with one hand. The utility knife is in her other hand... stuck between Rebecca's shoulder blades. Rebecca falls to the floor, bringing Sara down with her. She won't let go of Sara. As she gasps for air, she sees... Sara's tattoo, visible beneath her torn shirt. Sara self- consciously notices her looking at it. Rebecca reaches out and grabs Sara's hand. Sara lets go of her hand, and removes the necklace from around Rebecca's neck. Irene is trembling in the bed. Too shocked to say anything.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Stephen. Hold on. She finds her phone on the floor. She steps back to Stephen and cradles his head in her lap as she dials 911. He looks into her eyes and smiles. She smiles through her tears, love in her eyes.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Hey. How are you feeling? Stephen enters the room.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Better now. You being here's gonna help. Sara smiles.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Just got here.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Well let me give you some time to get settled in.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Actually, I need you right here, right now. Stephen grins. He likes where this is headed.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: Okay.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: This isn't exactly what I had in mind. Sara grins.

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Now I can get settled in.

Speaker: stephen
Dialogue: I'll be back to pick you up for dinner. You gonna be ready?

Speaker: sara
Dialogue: Absolutely. Stephen takes off down the hall. Sara follows him with her eyes before she goes back into her room.
